root.name: Daryl F. Gates' Police Quest: SWAT
root.description: Released by Sierra in 1995, Daryl F. Gates' Police Quest SWAT is a full-motion video game simulating the career of a new SWAT recruit at the Los Angeles Police Department. The game was a major design shift for the Police Quest series, moving away from adventure games and into the FMV genre that was flourishing in the mid-1990s. GameplayPolice Quest: SWAT is heavily reliant on training and following strict SWAT guidelines. The game is rather unforgiving with regards to following correct procedure during missions, referred to in the game as "call-ups".
